Pre-Game Insights: The Minnesota Twins and Kansas City Royals meet up as the two teams jockey for position in the AL wild-card race while hoping to keep their odds of winning the division alive.
The Boston Red Sox host the Chicago White Sox at Fenway Park.
Pablo LÃ³pez has been one of the best pitchers in baseball since the All-Star break, recording a 1.71 ERA in August.
Bobby Witt Jr. has been the biggest reason for the Royals' success, leading the American League in batting average as he nears another 30/30 season.
Crochet, however, has been one of the better pitchers in baseball this year, surprising in his first full season as a starter.
A three-game set against the White Sox could help the Red Sox get back on track, as Rafael Devers and Jarren Duran headline one of the best lineups in baseball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox's struggles have continued with interim manager Grady Sizemore, going 3-20 since he's taken over.
The Twins rank in the top 10 offensively in many categories, though they've had some struggles of late with Carlos Correa and Byron Buxton still on the injured list.
Chicago has had a miserable 2024 season and is on track to break the New York Mets' record for most losses in a single season (120 in 1962).
Others: The game between the Twins and Royals will be broadcast on FOX and the FOX Sports app at 7:15 p.m. ET.
The game between the White Sox and Red Sox will also be broadcast on FOX and the FOX Sports app at 7:15 p.m. ET.
